tags.name: Users
tags.description:
# Users API

Our fully [SCIM 2.0](http://www.simplecloud.info) compliant API to create, search, retrieve, update and remove user information.

> **Info**
All API calls require a valid token. See how to [obtain a token](/developer/api-reference#tag/oauth2).


## User Data Model

The User resource in Federated Directory is composed of three schemas:
1. **Core User**: `urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User`
2. **Enterprise Extension**: `urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User`
3. **FD Extension**: `urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:fd:2.0:User`

Technical details for all attributes (types, constraints, and descriptions) are available in the interactive sections below.

tags.name: MCP
tags.description:
# Model Context Protocol (MCP)

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) allows AI models to interact with your Federated Directory data in a safe and structured way. This API implements the [MCP standard](https://modelcontextprotocol.io), enabling LLMs (like Claude, ChatGPT, or custom agents) to:

- **List Tools**: Discover available operations (Search Users, Get Group, etc.).
- **Call Tools**: Execute specific actions on behalf of the user.
- **Read Resources**: Access directory information as context.

## Integration

To connect an MCP-compliant client to Federated Directory, use the endpoints documented below. The implementation supports the standard JSON-RPC 2.0 message format for tool execution and resource retrieval.

tags.name: OAuth2
tags.description:
# Obtaining a token

Any service or application that wants to integrate with the Federated Directory APIs needs to obtain an access token. This access token should be placed in the `Authorization` header of every API call as a Bearer token. Like this:

    Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...

## Audiences and roles

The combination of an audience (aud) and a role describe the authorizations of an access token.

An audience basically says for what kind of user the access token was created.

| Audience | Description                                                                                                                                                                     |
| :------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| User     | A user represents a person and is contained in a user directory. It's main purpose is for the usage of the platform by a person.                                                |
| Key      | A key is not linked to a natural person and is mainly intended for system integration. There are two kind of keys: a directory key and a admin key. Both have a different role. |

A role determines the authorizations given to an access token.

| Role         | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| :----------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| User         | Is not able to make changes to any other user in or the configuration in its company                                                                                                                                               |
| directoryKey | Always a key (audience) that has admin permissions on one specific directory in your Federated Directory. Ideal for integration with your current corporate address book or IAM solution (like Entra ID, Google Directory or Okta) |
| admin        | Full administrative permissions. Can modify all users and settings in its company                                                                                                                                                  |

## Retrieve an access token with a key

There are two sort of keys.

1. [Directory key](#create-a-directory-key) (role = directoryKey)
2. [API key](#create-an-api-key) (role = admin)

Decide which key is appropriate for your integration scenario.

### Create a directory key

Go to 'directories' and select the directory you want to integrate with.
Go to the "KEYS" tab and create a new key.

After the key has been created you will receive three things:

1. issuer
2. private key
3. access token

The access token is only returned directly after you create the key. This access token is
valid for many years. So keep it secure!

The 'issuer' and 'private key' can be used to [create access tokens](#create-an-access-token-with-the-issuer-and-private-key). These tokens have the
same lifetime as a user session. This is [configurable per tenant](/administrator/company)
but has a default value of 480 minutes (8 hours).

### Create an API key

An API key has the same permissions as a user with the 'administrator' role.

To create such a key, go to 'integrations' in the menu and create a new key.

After the key has been created you will receive two things:

1. issuer
2. private key

The 'issuer' and 'private key' can be used to [create access tokens](#create-an-access-token-with-the-issuer-and-private-key). These tokens have the
same lifetime as a user session. This is [configurable per tenant](/administrator/company)
but has a default value of 480 minutes (8 hours).

## Create an access token with the issuer and private key

Place the 'issuer' value of your key in the below JSON.

```json
{
  "iss": "<issuer>",
  "scope": ["directoryKey"], // ["admin"] if this is the API key and not Directory key
  "aud": "key"
}
```

Use RS256 encryption to create and parse a JWT token. Use your 'private key' for this.
There are a [a lot of libraries](https://jwt.io/libraries) available that can do this.

This JWT can then be submitted by a POST action to this end-point :

get.description: Returns the SCIM service provider configuration from the root path
Returns metadata for OAuth 2.0 discovery (RFC 8707). This allows clients to discover how to authenticate with this specific resource.
Returns the SCIM service provider configuration
Returns 401 with WWW-Authenticate header to trigger authentication discovery for MCP clients (like Mistral). The response includes links to OAuth 2.0 metadata as per RFC 8707.

post.summary: MCP JSON-RPC Endpoint - Multi-method Model Context Protocol handler
post.description:
Handles Model Context Protocol (MCP) JSON-RPC 2.0 requests. 

### Supported MCP Methods
- **initialize**: Initial handshake to exchange version and capabilities.
- **tools/list**: List available tools for the current user/company.
- **tools/call**: Execute a specific search or retrieval tool.
- **ping**: Simple connectivity and availability check.

### Supported Tools Reference
| Tool Name | Description | Required Arguments |
|:---|:---|:---|
| `search_contacts_by_name` | Search contacts by name, givenName, or familyName | `name` |
| `search_contacts_by_email` | Search contacts by email address (partial supported) | `email` |
| `get_contact_by_id` | Get full SCIM user details by ID | `id` |
| `search_contacts_by_division` | Search for contacts within a specific division | `division` |
| `search_contacts_by_department` | Search for contacts within a specific department | `department` |
| `search_contacts_by_manager` | Find all direct reports for a specific manager ID | `managerId` |
| `search_contacts_by_employee_number` | Retrieve contact by employee number | `employeeNumber` |
| `search_contacts_by_company` | Search contacts by organization/company name | `company` |
| `search_contacts_by_title` | Search contacts by job title | `title` |
| `search_contacts_by_custom_01` | Search by Custom Field 1 (Company defined) | `value` |
| `search_contacts_by_custom_02` | Search by Custom Field 2 (Company defined) | `value` |
| `search_contacts_by_custom_03` | Search by Custom Field 3 (Company defined) | `value` |

*Note: All search tools support an optional `limit` (1-100) and `attributes` (comma-separated list) parameter.*

Resources.name: User
Resources.description: User data forms your directory and they can search your Federated Directory

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Globally Unique identifier for the User. Used for all UPDATE and DELETE actions.REQUIRED on a user.

attributes.name: externalId
attributes.description: Identifier of the user from the mastering source.

attributes.name: userName
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the User, typically used by the user to directly authenticate or to map with the username within the identity provider. Each User MUST include a non - empty userName value.This identifier MUST be unique within a directory within company. REQUIRED on a user.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The components of the user's real name. Returns the individual component attributes using the other sub - attributes.

subAttributes.name: familyName
subAttributes.description: The family name of the User, or last name in most Western languages(e.g., 'Jensen' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

subAttributes.name: givenName
subAttributes.description: The given name of the User, or first name in most Western languages(e.g., 'Barbara' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

attributes.name: displayName
attributes.description: The name of the User, suitable for display to end - users. The name SHOULD be the full name of the User being described.

attributes.name: nickName
attributes.description: The casual way to address the user in real life, e.g.,'Bob' or 'Bobby' instead of 'Robert'.

attributes.name: profileUrl
attributes.description: A fully qualified URL pointing to a page representing the User 's online profile.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The user's title, such as Vice President.

attributes.name: userType
attributes.description: Used to identify the relationship between the organization and the user.Typical values used might be 'Contractor', 'Employee','Intern','Temp','External', and 'Unknown', but any value may be used.

attributes.name: preferredLanguage
attributes.description: Indicates the User's preferred written or spoken language.e.g., 'en_US' specifies the language English and country US.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: Used to indicate the User's default location for purposes of localizing items such as currency, date time format, or numerical representations.

attributes.name: timezone
attributes.description: The User's time zone in the 'Olson' time zone database format, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the User's administrative status.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: The User's cleartext password. This attribute is intended to be used as a means to specify an initial password when creating a new User or to reset an existing User 's password.

attributes.name: emails
attributes.description: Email addresses for the user. Canonical type values of 'work','home', and 'other'.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: Email addresses for the user. Canonical type values of 'work','home', and 'other'.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the attribute's function, e.g., 'work' or 'home'.

subAttributes.name: primary
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the 'primary' or preferred attribute value for this attribute,  e.g.,the preferred mailing address or primary email address.The primary attribute value 'true'. Always fixed to the 'work' email address

attributes.name: phoneNumbers
attributes.description: Phone numbers for the User. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider according to the format specified in RFC 3966, e.g.,'+1-201-555-0123'. Canonical type values of 'work','home' and 'mobile'

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: Phone number of the User.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the attribute's function, e.g., 'work', 'home', 'mobile'.

subAttributes.name: primary
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the 'primary' or preferred attribute value for this attribute, e.g., the preferred phone number or primary phone number. Fixed to the 'work' phone'

attributes.name: photos
attributes.description: URLs of photos of the User.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: URL of a photo of the User.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the attribute's function, 'photo' or 'thumbnail'.

subAttributes.name: primary
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the 'primary' or preferred attribute value for this attribute, e.g., the preferred  photo or thumbnail.Fixed to the 'photo' type.

attributes.name: addresses
attributes.description: A physical mailing address for this User.  Canonical type values of 'work',  'home',   and 'other'.This attribute is a complex type with the following sub - attributes.

subAttributes.name: streetAddress
subAttributes.description: The full street address component,  which may include house number,   street name,     P.O.box,   and multi - line extended street address information.This attribute MAY contain newlines.

subAttributes.name: locality
subAttributes.description: The city or locality component.

subAttributes.name: region
subAttributes.description: The state or region component.

subAttributes.name: postalCode
subAttributes.description: The zip code or postal code component.

subAttributes.name: country
subAttributes.description: The country name component.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the attribute's    function,   e.g.,  'work' and 'home'.

attributes.name: roles
attributes.description: The role for the User that collectively represent the entitlements of a user within Federated Directory. Defaults to 'user'.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: The value of a role.

subAttributes.name: display
subAttributes.description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes.READ - ONLY.

attributes.name: meta
attributes.description: Metadata on the user object. Only returned when User info is retrieved on one specific User id.

subAttributes.name: created
subAttributes.description: Date and time when the User was created.

subAttributes.name: lastModified
subAttributes.description: The most recent DateTime that the details of this User were updated. If this User has never been modified since its initial creation, the value has the same as 'created'.

subAttributes.name: location
subAttributes.description: The URI of the User being returned

subAttributes.name: resourceType
subAttributes.description: The name of the resource type of the resource. In this case, always 'User'.

attributes.name: employeeNumber
attributes.description: Numeric or alphanumeric identifier assigned to a person, typically based on order of hire or association with an   organization.

attributes.name: costCenter
attributes.description: Identifies the name of a cost center.

attributes.name: organization
attributes.description: Identifies the name of the organization.

attributes.name: division
attributes.description: Identifies the name of a division.

attributes.name: department
attributes.description: Identifies the name of a department.

attributes.name: manager
attributes.description: The User's manager. A complex type that creates an organizational hierarchy by referencing the 'id' attribute of another User. Include 'id' (value) to create an actual link. Also allows adding only a displayName. If id/value is provided, displayName will be ignored.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the User 's manager. OPTIONAL.

subAttributes.name: $ref
subAttributes.description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the User 's manager. OPTIONAL.

subAttributes.name: displayName
subAttributes.description: The displayName of the User's manager. Will be ignored if value is also provided. OPTIONAL.

Resources.name: FederatedDirectoryUser
Resources.description: Federated Directory specific User schema extension

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description or note on a User.

attributes.name: companyId
attributes.description: The unique identifier of the User's Company

attributes.name: companyLogos
attributes.description: URLs of the logos of the Company.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: URL of a logo of the Company.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the attribute's function, 'logo' or 'thumbnail'.

attributes.name: companyLogos
attributes.description: URL of logo of the User's Company

attributes.name: directoryId
attributes.description: The unique identifier of the Directory this User resides in.

attributes.name: custom01
attributes.description: Custom attribute that can be used to extend the users default attributes.

attributes.name: custom02
attributes.description: Custom attribute that can be used to extend the users default attributes.

attributes.name: custom03
attributes.description: Custom attribute that can be used to extend the users default attributes.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: The groups in which a user is a member.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: Uuid of the group

subAttributes.name: display
subAttributes.description: The name of the Group, suitable for display to end - users.

subAttributes.name: owner
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the User's administrative status in a group.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Globally Unique identifier for the Group. Used for all UPDATE and DELETE actions. REQUIRED on a group.

attributes.name: externalId
attributes.description: Identifier of the group from the mastering source.

attributes.name: displayName
attributes.description: A human-readable name for the Group. REQUIRED.

attributes.name: members
attributes.description: A list of members of the Group.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: Identifier of the member of this Group.

subAttributes.name: $ref
subAttributes.description: The URI of the corresponding Group member resource.

subAttributes.name: display
subAttributes.description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the type of resource, e.g., 'User' or 'Group'.
